reviewText: It's a fun game. Not the best game I've ever played, but it's entertaining and has an EarthBound/MOTHER-like charm to it, and the screenshots don't quite do it justice- its chibi style looked cheap at first glance, but I liked it after a short time in-game. Random end-of-mission drops (although with listed odds, which is nice) seems a bit of a turn-off, but it's not a huge issue. As it's so new, I haven't gotten a chance to try it out with other players yet, but I'm eager for the chance to. So if you're all tired out of seriousness like Call of Duty or Counter-Strike, why not give a go at something... cuter?

reviewText:
In my opinion, it is one of the best co-op games of the recent period. Most importantly, the co-op experience is not limited: you and your co-player(s) participate equally in missions and both get all the awards/benefits. The lobby system is also nice in that you can team up with random people in a griefless and completely optional manner.

The game is beginner/casual player friendly, but the difficulty level can be adjusted to be more challenging, There is also lots to do: shoot up monsters, complete mission objectives, collect and upgrade weapons and gather cute outfits. So far, there are 20 maps, but there is promise of more.

Lastly, the visuals are completely adorable and you can customize your character at any time with a multitude of appearance/clothing options available. I would definitely recommend trying this cute little game out and giving it a chance to grow into something more, perhaps. It is awesome when your co-op gaming is not bound by arbitrary limits.

reviewText:
GOCCO OF WAR:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Welcome to the Gocco Studio Japan, an incredible theme park where you can be part of an imaginary war and fight against enemies created by a hyper-holographic simulator. All you have to do is to pick up one of several ecological weapons available to you which are powered by air and jump into battle on your own or with friends via the online mode.

GOCCO OF WAR is an action/co-op type of game. First, you have to create your Chibi (Japanese slang to describe a person who is vertically challenged) which is really fun especially when you have a fair few options to choose from. Then you have to decide if you want to play online or offline. Either way, you will end up in a lobby. There you will have Chibis you can talk to and find a little bit more of what to do. Also, you will have 3 stands and a billboard.

To do a quest, just go to the quest stand. There you will be able to activate one. There are 21 quests available to you in the game but you have beat the quest to get access to the next one. During the quest, you will be able to pick up items and gold. At the craft stand, you can enhance or create other weapons. If you accumulate enough gold during your quest, head straight up to the shop stand where you can purchase more powerful weapons. The billboard is a tool for the online mode where you can join a party of 4 on a quest.

The combat system is very easy to master and the levels are well designed. This is a really cute, fun game to play by yourself or with your friends. For the control side of the equation, I personally prefer to play with the mouse and keyboard. Nothing wrong with the gamepad by the way but I just think using the mouse and keyboard is better.
Up to 30 different foes to fight against, some will throw projectiles and some will run towards you from left, right and centre.

Positives:
~~~~~~~~

-	Cute graphics
-	Fun and easy gameplay
-	Great Chibi customization
-	Good range of enemies
-	Offline and Online mode
-	Achievements and Trading cards

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~

-	Could have been a little more challenging

A truly enjoyable game to play, it is cute, it is fun and it has a lot of chibis! I like it a lot!

8.5/10

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

MORE THE_CPT_FROGGY REVIEWS HERE

FOLLOW THE CPT FROGGY CURATOR PAGE HERE

reviewText:
I was gifted this game by my girlfriend earlier today and the first impressions are very positive. Was really easy to set up a lobby and the keys are all rebindable, which some people may appreciate since the initial binds are a bit wonky.

The game itself looks quite good, not a graphical masterpiece by any stretch of the imagination but it has it's charm for sure. The gameplay itself is a quite basic 3rd person shooter but it absolutely works and the varied missions are a rather nice touch as well. I don't know how many missions there are in total but they do have replayability since there are different difficulty levels that offer a higher drop chance for some of the more rare materials.

Speaking of materials, the crafting system that this game offers is also rather basic but functional. There are a lot of items to discover and craft, which is a big plus. Customization is something that this game offers plenty of!

Summary: Great little game to play with your friends (lobbies offer up to 32 slots for players, only 4 people can go on a mission together though). Easy to learn yet fun to play, will also offer a decent amount of gameplay for it's cost. If you do have a few friends interested in the game and some money to spare then do give it a shot!

reviewText:
If you are searching a cute game to play with someone, I really recommend this game.

The game might look simple itself, but seriously, I enjoy it a whole lots and the community is really nice as well!

Pros :
- For every age, can be enjoy by everyone.
- Nice and simple.
- Cute.
- Easy (might be a cons for some that would want a lots of challenge), is not a game where you would see people rage.
- Many adorable customization for your character (and of course I would wish some more in the future!)
- Story is really enjoyable, really fun and cute for a small world!
- Third person view that you can switch between a long range weapon or a short range weapon.
- Control can be a bit confusing at 1st, since is different from many games, but is REALLY easy to learn and get use to it!
- Relax games.
- REALLY A NICE CO-OP GAMES!!!!!!

Cons :
- There is still not a lots of feature, such as pvp, but the game is pretty new.
- Is not an open-world, I saw the screenshot and video, and I thought it was one until I got in-game.
- Could be repetitif if you want to farm item or gold, since there isn't a lots of quest and if you want 100% achievement, you'll have to be patient.
- Not a lots of people, the community isn't really big since the game itself is new, but IS REALLY A NICE COMMUNITY!
- Lobby can only have up to 32 peoples, right now I never saw a full lobby, but hopefully if there is more player that they could add more slots.

In conclusion, I'm really looking foward for the future feature of this game or an improved version with a bigger world! Really keep it up creators! Nice games!

reviewText: I first saw this game while I was vacationing in Japan at an indie game convention in Kyoto (Bitsummit 2015). I never gave it too much attention until it released on Steam and I've been having a blast since. Though the aesthetics and style of the game may lean more cutesy than I'm used to, the gameplay is what keeps me coming back (and the potential for the game to improve due to the developer's involvement with the community). If you've ever enjoyed co-op games (PSO fans especially), you'd be right at home with Gocco. It's a blast playing with friends, and the community is very friendly and helpful.

reviewText:
My System SpecWindows 8.1, i5-4570 3.5GHz, 16GB DDR3, Nvidia GeForce GTX 970
English and Japanese Language for text30 FPS Lock
Gameplay
Its a 3rd person shooter. You dont have ammo but a energy bar at least from what i saw so far same with the sword it uses energy to attack. You have special attack. You just stop shooting then you gain energy or collect blue balls.
Red ball HP, Yellow gold for buying items in the hub town.

Hub Town
Has a hub town where you pick quest, craft or buy things. Has cute npcs to talk to but this is the main place where you talk to random people if you pick online.

No levelling up Badge system
As far as i played you dont level up but each stage you gain badges. Each one has a rank and you can equip 5 slots. They boost attribute of your stats. This is like leveling up but with items.

Screen Tearing
Pretty bad tearing i had to use my nvidia control panel to add vsync now it looks fine. The game is running 30fps so it feels weird.

Pro
Lots of cute hair to pick fromOn the fly appearance change at hub townEasy gameplay just 3rd person shooterOffline mode can play by yourselfNo microtransactions
Con
Doesnt feel good on KB+MNot much to exploreFeels like a free to play gameNo leveling up systemScreen Tearing30 FPS

reviewText:
I haven't played much just about 4 hours so I'm just telling my first impression.
It's a cute little chibi single/co-op shooter game where you can create your own chibi character and later on you can buy more stuff for yourself by collecting coins while your playing (hats, masks, outfits, guns etc.)
After that you are ready to play by yourself or with other players online.
Shooting monsters/bullies and trying to save everyone. There's different levels and of course more you complete the levels more harder it gets.
The game style is cute, soundtrack lovely and the idea of the game is okey too.
The only minus is that all functions aren't working properly. Like when I finish the levels I get to see how I did at the end but the text boxes are empty (or maybe the game just wanted to safe me for the disappointment because I did so badly) but I think that the developers are working with that problem!
Over all I like this game and I reccomend this for you if you like cute chibi games who are trying to be heros yay!

8/10

reviewText:
30FPS lock alert and if u had motionsickness stay away from this. (Personally had motionsickness problems)

Game is good:

1. Like Super Mario Galaxy, u need some good jumping skills to go pass some missions.
2. All characters look adorable and cute.
3. Monster Hunter style gameplay (Material Farming with Mission choose and go lobby)
4. Full controller support.
5. The lobby is with friendly people.

Con:

3. The camera is abit not smooth if you ask me, feeling sick after playing for 1 hours.
4. The monster is cute, but as an action game, the movement of everything is abit dummy.

Will definately keep this game in library and hope it will become a better game.

reviewText:
When I first saw this game, I thought it was adorable but didn't think it had much to it. I was right on both thoughts. The game is truly adorable and very fun to play but the amount of content it has is fairly limited. In my 8.5 hours of gameplay, I haven't finished it yet, but, If you rush through the quests on the easiest difficulty, you will have it completed in less than 8 hours, If you take your time and just play casually, you can make the fun last longer and longer. To my knowledge, there are only 18 quests and, as of this post, I just recently completed Quest 12. The game is about grinding to get outfits and weapons, but the grind isn't tormenting like many games.

The only real downfall this game holds is its very small community. It is rare to ever see a public server on the server list which seems to discourage people from playing online. This game seems to be a game you play with a group of friends, or solo, rather than meeting friends on it. If you choose to make a server, it is likely that a few people will join, but it might not be a lot. I do not know too much about the community so it could be more active than I am seeing. When I joined a few servers in January, I had no idea what I was doing but the community I met was very helpful; I never once met a troll. (I could just be lucky.)

In my opinion, $20 is a stretch to spend on this game, but, if you want a very casual game, this is the game for you, though it can get hectic at times. I impulse bought this game but I do not regret it. There is  a demo you can try out if you're skeptical, it will teach you the basics and show what the game is like. If you're considering this game, try the demo first.

Do I recommend this game? Yes. I will update this review when I play it more. Hope this helps.

Edit: I am, currently, at 11.1 hours into the game, and I finally beat the final quest. There are 20 quests in the game but each are fairly unique, despite most using the same level layouts(never the same). I liked the game storyline, it was cute. Despite my completing the game, I only played on Easy Mode, which is the easiest of the three difficulties. There are also items called badges for stat benefits, but I never used any. I also never enhanced my weapons, but it is possible to do so. There is so much of the game that I have not yet experienced.

I still recommend this game to anyone who may be interested.

Edit2: I am, currently, at 16.7 hours into the game and I found the community! My problem with finding people playing was mostly because I was playing at around midnight, EST, when most people are in various timezones around the world. The people I met were friendly, helpful, and all around fun to talk to. There is a community, albeit a fairly small one, and the developers often pop into the game to talk with their players to get personal, chibi to chibi, feedback about the game.

Though I am 16.7 hours into the game, I am still learning a lot with each passing minute. This game is far beyond worth it to purchase at its price and I expect great things for it based on what I have seen.

reviewText:
I play this purely for the social aspect. A lot of people from all around the world play this game, and they're all really friendly. Of course, there is a language barrier, but that's why there are macros that have text in the preferred language of each party involved for their client.

The questing and the progression is a lovely bonus. Gives you a reason to play with people that are behind you in questing.
Getting 100% in this game isn't TOO hard, but it'll certainly take a while, adding to the hours you'll spend on this game.

reviewText:
Fun game so far and I certainly play to spend more time on it.

Gameplay: the game is primarily a shooter with some melee options. All attacks are powered by air which can regenerate fairly quickly or be picked up in capsules around the level. The controls are simple and easy. The shooting isn't crazy intense, but that's good. It's casual.
Music: nothing I would listen to outside the game, but it works in the environments it's intended for and conveys the right moods.
Story: the setting is a themepark for kiddos to run around in programmed stories and encounters to shoot holographic enemies with air-powered weapons. With that being said there are some darker undertones and humor that you may find amusing. I know I did.

Personally I recommend the game, although there aren't very many people online at any one time. It hasn't been out very long so I hope more people come in over time.

reviewText: Gocco of war is an awesome cutesy anime shooter, where you play in a simulated virtual world and complete quests. The goal of the game is all about grinding, you have to get new weapons, upgrades, new materials, and most importantly, clothes. There's a huge amount of cosmetics you can get, around 200+. The grinding isn't boring though, because it's challenging. The game is a lot harder then it looks. Fun gameplay, cute characters and visuals, enough to do to keep you satisfied for a long time. If you're an achievement hunter like me, you will spend many hours in this game.  The only downside it has is that there could be more quests, and maybe more info on badges and on how to upgrade stuff. The music could be more varied too. No other downside except for that, this would make a great mmorpg too. 9.5/10, one of my new favourites.

reviewText:
I have multiple problems with this game. The framerate is low (locked at 30fps, and I know I can get 60+ on ANY other game), the controls are very clunky on both keyboard and controller, and the game is unnecessarily difficult due to a combo of bad controls and steep difficulty curve. These all contribute to a poor experience.

Customization options were welcome, but a convoluted crafting system makes obtaining cosmetics a chore. Combining two items could give you one of the same items you used to craft, with no added perk. There were only 3-4 people online for both of my 20-30 minute sessions, so not many to show off the few cosmetics I had.

The English translation is choppy, and the story baffles me. It seems to be a lighthearted kids' game, but in the first level, Satan makes an appearance AND themes such as death, evil in its purest form, and the apocalypse are brought up. IN THE FIRST LEVEL! But I don't think this game is meant to be played for the story, anyway. It is definitely gameplay-centric. So no big deal. But overall, the game is simply not worth its current price.

EDIT: Whoa, the dev responded to my review minutes after me posting. And with that, I realized my original review was a bit too harsh, so I edited it accordingly. It was kinda unfair to judge a game immediately upon its release. I mean, even big companies like Bethesda launch patches directly following release. I figured this was a lazy port of a Japanese game, but now my gut tells me I'm wrong. The developer cares about their game, stating a desire to continually improve the game. And, maybe when the game is a bit more polished, I'll come back, as the concept is promising. Until then.
